perturbation.original_text: "Business Associate" means the Kallo Authorized Agent who could be an individual, organization, or company that  desires to represent the Kallo Mobile care suite of products of Kallo Inc., to the end user (customer) market. The  Business Associate as it will be defined in this agreement sells the Kallo Mobile care product suite only. Kallo will be  fully responsible for the training and implementation of the client
perturbation.changed_text: "Business Associate" means the Kallo Authorized Agent who could be an individual, organization, or company that  desires to represent the Kallo Mobile care suite of products of Kallo Inc., to the end user (customer) market. The  Business Associate as it will be defined in this agreement markets the Kallo Mobile care product suite only. Kallo will be  fully responsible for the training and implementation of the client
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'sells' to 'markets' creates ambiguity. Does the Business Associate have the authority to finalize sales, or just promote the products? This introduces uncertainty in their obligations.

perturbation.original_text: Responsibilities: Responsibilities of the Agent (PDMS and Gateway) are defined in Schedule C. Failure to comply  with this will be considered a material breach of this agreement. This also includes responsibilities for Kallo and the  project management entity (BASCIC) appointed jointly by Kallo and the Agent.
perturbation.changed_text: Responsibilities: Responsibilities of the Agent (PDMS and Gateway) are defined in Schedule C. Failure to comply  with this will be considered a significant issue with this agreement. This also includes responsibilities for Kallo and the  project management entity (BASCIC) appointed jointly by Kallo and the Agent.
perturbation.explanation: By replacing 'material breach' with 'significant issue', it is not clear what level of non-compliance is acceptable. Does a 'significant issue' lead to termination, penalties, or just a discussion? This ambiguity creates uncertainty in enforcement.
perturbation.location: Section 2.KALLO SALES AGENT PROGRAM TERMS AND CONDITIONS - b)

perturbation.original_text: Kallo shall pay over all funds collected from the Book of Business and due to Agent, less a reasonable administration  fee to be assessed and determined by Kallo, to Agent or its designees or assigns immediately upon receipt and act as  a conduit for Agent funds, except in as far as Kallo or its assignees are required to support customers in the Book of  Business in which case the cost of providing such support, will be reasonably assessed and appropriate deductions  made before passing the balance to Agent.
perturbation.changed_text: Kallo shall transfer all funds collected from the Book of Business and due to Agent, less a service fee to be assessed and determined by Kallo, to Agent or its designees or assigns immediately upon receipt and act as  a conduit for Agent funds, except in as far as Kallo or its assignees are required to support customers in the Book of  Business in which case the cost of providing such support, will be determined and deductions  made before transferring the balance to Agent.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'reasonable administration fee' to 'service fee' and removing the word 'reasonably' implies Kallo's discretion is unlimited. This contradiction introduces uncertainty in the amount the Agent will actually receive.
